snippet: New legislation, promoted as making only technical changes in a financial regulation law, could end up gutting some of its provisions.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column observes that new Republican-led Congress is already mounting legislative attempts to dismantle regulations established under the 2010 Dodd-Frank Act; examines narrowly-failed bill that would have extended deadline for federally-insured institutions that are still holding collateralized loan obligations and reduce transparency of derivatives trading.
lead_paragraph: New legislation, promoted as making only technical changes in a financial regulation law, could end up gutting some of its provisions.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
